item.title: On Not Carrying a Camera
item.description: The ten thousand photographs stored on a cellphone are a dramatic refutation of my photographic diffidence.

Manually managing languages in your app? There's a better way! Check out how the ABP Language Management Module lets you add and control languages effortlessly.

item.title: Does .NET Documentation get ads? Aka: Is Copilot in the docs something useful?
item.description: The dotnet documentation gets hints about using GitHub Copilot. Is this an ad? And can we expect more in the future?

item.title: The Alabama Landline That Keeps Ringing
The Pocket Dimension: Motivation Now & Post AGI · Philipp Cannons
item.description: Inspired by James P. Carse’s infinite-games lens, Will Storr’s status research, David Pearce’s pleasure blueprint, Eliezer Yudkowsky’s fun puzzles, and Naval Ravikant’s wealth axioms. Last Human Standing Day three after humanity vanishes. The pantry’s stocked. Your shelter’s secure. You sit on the hood of an abandoned Ferrari at sunrise, watching the empty city gleam. With […]

item.title: Why Your 'Perfect' Team Is Actually Falling Apart: Communication Matters
item.description: Messages carry feelings we often miss. When teammates don't understand each other, it hurts more than the work. It breaks trust. See why short messages seem angry, silence feels like disagreement, and confusion turns to blame. Simple fixes for the hidden problems that pull teams apart.

item.title: Another look into PostgreSQL CTE materialization and non-idempotent subqueries
item.description: A follow-up exploration into PostgreSQL CTE materialization, diving deeper into why non-idempotent subqueries can execute multiple times, leading to unexpected results.

item.title: Hyperparameter Tuning is just a Resource Scheduling Problem
item.description: When you hear hyperparameter tuning, you might think of trying lots of different model settings to find the best one—maybe using grid search, random search, or some fancy algorithm. But when you’re doing this at scale, especially with limited time or compute, it’s not just about finding the best settings. It’s about how you manage your resources. You have a bunch of models to try, but you can’t run them all fully.

item.title: Two Years Building a Startup – Sebastian Hooker
item.description: I left my career in big tech in July of 2023 to try my hand at entrepreneurship. I had just turned 31 and figured if I didn’t take the chance now, I was probably never going to. On a risk-adjusted basis, it’s been a horrible financial decision. However, it’s also been the most professionally fulfilled I’ve ever been in my life, and if we succeed in executing on our vision, the financial payoff could make it even better.

item.title: Know Your Enemy: How Three Years at McKinsey Shaped My Second Startup
item.description: “If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles. If you know yourself but not the enemy, for every victory gained you will also suffer a defeat. If you...
